content: विग्रहः {@--1@} Stretching out, extension, expansion. {@--2@} Form, figure, shape. {@--3@} The body; त्रयी विग्रहवत्येव सममध्यात्मविद्यया <ls>M. 1. 14</ls>; गूढविग्रहः <ls>R. 3. 39</ls>, <ls n="R.">9. 52</ls>; <ls>Ki. 4. 11</ls>, <ls n="Ki.">12. 43.</ls> {@--4@} Resolution, dissolution, analysis, separation (as of a compound word into its component parts); वृत्त्यर्थ (समासार्थ) बोधकं वाक्यं विग्रहः. {@--5@} Quarrel, strife (often, lovequarrel or प्रणयकलह); विग्रहाच्च शयने पराङ्मुखीर्नानुनेतुमबलाः स तत्वरे <ls>R. 19. 38</ls>, <ls n="R.">9. 47</ls>; <ls>Śi. 11. 35.</ls> {@--6@} War, hostilities, fighting, battle (<ab>opp.</ab> संधि), one of the six Guṇas or modes of policy; see गुण. {@--7@} Disfavour. {@--8@} A part, portion, division.
